item.description: ç½‘é¼æ¯-Qualifier-2022/ç„æ­¦ç»„/Crypto/crypto557(new_stream) Writeup 1. challenge é™„ä»¶ä¸‹è½½ï¼šhttps://pan.baidu.com/share/init?surl=Rar0fxHzpDiL4bK8AP2Zbw æå–ç ï¼šGAME new_stream.py from Crypto.Util.number import * import random from secret import flag f = open("output.txt","w") for i in range(18): p = getPrime(256) x = random.randint(2, p-1) tmp = bytes_to_long(flag) enc = [] for j in range(size(tmp)): r = random.randint(2, p-1) if tmp%2: enc += [pow(x, r, p)] else: enc += [r] tmp //= 2 f.write("p = " + str(p) + "\n") f.write("enc = " + str(enc) + "\n") output.

item.description:
ç½‘é¼æ¯-Qualifier-2022/ç™½è™ç»„/Crypto/? writeup é¢˜ç›®åå­—ä¸çŸ¥é“ challenge from Crypto.Util.number import getPrime import hashlib e = 2022 m = getPrime(512) m1 = getPrime(512) m2 = getPrime(512) flag = m+m1+m2 flag = hashlib.md5(str(flag).encode('utf-8')).hexdigest() c1 = pow(m+m1, e, m*m1) c2 = pow(m+m2, e, m*m2) c3 = pow(m1+m2, e, m1*m2) x = pow(m1+2022, m, m*m1) y = pow(m2+2022, m, m*m2) z = pow(m+2022, m1, m*m1) print("c1 = ", c1) print("c2 = ", c2) print("c3 = ", c3) print("x = ", x) print("y = ", y) print("z = ", z) åˆ†æ $$  egin{align} & (m+m_1)^e \equiv c_1 \mod mm_1 
otag 
ewline & (m+m_2)^e \equiv c_2 \mod mm_2 
otag 
ewline & (m_1+m_2)^e \equiv c_3 \mod m_1m_2 
otag 
ewline & (m_1+e)^m \equiv x \mod mm_1 
otag 
ewline & (m_2+e)^m \equiv y \mod mm_2 
otag 
ewline & (m+e)^{m_1} \equiv z \mod mm_1 
otag \end{align} $$

item.title: Original Mails with Bitnami for CVE-2021-21979
item.description: tags: email Original Mails with Bitnami for CVE-2021-21979 [1] [Vulnerability Report] APP_KEY is fixed in docker image bitnami/laravel st0n3 ss ssst0n3@gmail.com 23 February 2021 at 15:58 To: security@vmware.com Hello, bitnami! I am a security researcher. Seems I have found a vulnerability in docker image bitnami/laravel. Please check it, thank you! 1. Description if file /app/config/database.php not exists when users use image bitnami/laravel, the file /app/.env will be replaced by file /tmp/app/.

item.title: p32 or p64 or struct ?
item.description: tags: ctf,pwn p32 or p64 or struct ? >>> from pwn import * >>> import struct >>> p32(0xdeadbeef) '\xef\xbe\xad\xde' >>> struct.pack("I",0xdeadbeef) == p32(0xdeadbeef) True >>> p64(0xdeadbeef) '\xef\xbe\xad\xde\x00\x00\x00\x00' >>> struct.pack("l",0xdeadbeef) == p64(0xdeadbeef) True reference pwntools doc struct doc
